verses.verse: How beautiful <S%H3302><s%> are your feet <S%H6471><s%> in sandals, <S%H5275><s%> prince <S%H5081><s%>'s daughter! <S%H1323><s%> Your rounded <S%H2542><s%> thighs <S%H3409><s%> are like jewels, <S%H2481><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of a skillful workman. <S%H542><s%>

Your body <S%H8326><s%> is like a round <S%H5469><s%> goblet, <S%H101><s%> no mixed <S%H2637><s%> wine <S%H4197><s%> is wanting. <S%H990><s%> Your waist is like a heap <S%H6194><s%> of wheat, <S%H2406><s%> set about <S%H5473><s%> with lilies. <S%H7799><s%>
Your two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> <S%H99999><s%> fawns, <S%H6646><s%> that are twins of a roe. <S%H8380><s%>

Your neck <S%H6677><s%> is like an ivory <S%H8127><s%> tower. <S%H4026><s%> Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> are like the pools <S%H1295><s%> in Heshbon <S%H2809><s%> by the gate <S%H8179><s%> of Bathrabbim. <S%H1337><s%> Your nose <S%H639><s%> is like the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> which looks <S%H6822><s%> toward <S%H6440><s%> Damascus. <S%H1834><s%>

Your head <S%H7218><s%> on you is like Carmel. <S%H3760><s%> The hair <S%H1803><s%> of your head <S%H7218><s%> like purple. <S%H713><s%> The king <S%H4428><s%> is held <S%H631><s%> captive in its tresses. <S%H7298><s%>
How beautiful <S%H3302><s%> and how pleasant <S%H5276><s%> you are, <S%H160><s%> love, for delights! <S%H8588><s%>
This, <S%H6967><s%> your stature, is like <S%H1819><s%> a palm tree, <S%H8558><s%> your breasts <S%H7699><s%> like its fruit. <S%H811><s%>

I said, <S%H559><s%> "I will climb up <S%H5927><s%> into the palm tree. <S%H8558><s%> I will take hold <S%H270><s%> of its fruit. <S%H5577><s%>" Let your breasts <S%H7699><s%> be like clusters <S%H811><s%> of the vine, <S%H1612><s%> the smell <S%H7381><s%> of your breath <S%H639><s%> like apples, <S%H8598><s%> Beloved

Your mouth <S%H2441><s%> like the best <S%H2896><s%> wine, <S%H3196><s%> that goes <S%H1980><s%> down smoothly <S%H4339><s%> for my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> gliding <S%H1680><s%> through the lips <S%H8193><s%> of those who are asleep. <S%H3463><s%>
I am my beloved <S%H1730><s%>'s. His desire is toward me. <S%H8669><s%>
Come, <S%H3212><s%> my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> let us go forth <S%H3318><s%> into the field. <S%H7704><s%> Let us lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the villages. <S%H3723><s%>

Let <S%H7925><s%>'s go early up to the vineyards. <S%H3754><s%> Let <S%H7200><s%>'s see whether the vine <S%H1612><s%> has budded, <S%H6524><s%> its blossom <S%H6524><s%> is open, <S%H6605><s%> and the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> are in flower. <S%H5132><s%> There I will give <S%H5414><s%> you my love. <S%H1730><s%>

The mandrakes <S%H1736><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> forth fragrance. <S%H7381><s%> At our doors <S%H6607><s%> are all kinds of precious <S%H4022><s%> fruits, <S%H2319><s%> new and old, <S%H3465><s%> which I have stored up <S%H6845><s%> for you, <S%H1730><s%> my beloved.
